info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:53PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN LITCHFIELD...NORTHERN LITCHFIELD...EASTERN DUTCHESS...AND WESTERN DUTCHESS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 253 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Dover Plains to Lake Carmel and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Sherman and Kent around 300 PM EST. New Fairfield around 305 PM EST. Brookfield around 310 PM EST. New Preston around 315 PM EST. Litchfield around 320 PM EST. Thomaston and Northwest Harwinton around 330 PM EST. Terryville and Oakville around 335 PM EST. Waterbury around 340 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
